title.narrative: 4.4: HIGH-QUALITY AND TIMELY DATA AND ANALYSIS FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: The situation of children from all socioeconomic backgrounds, and including those with disabilities, is monitored at the national and subnational levels, through disaggregated, high-quality and timely data and analysis that informs national and sub-national policies, strategies and budgets that benefit children, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys live in more-inclusive and resilient communities strengthened by an enabling environment and systems that createequitable chances in life.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The situation of children from all socioeconomic backgrounds, and including those with disabilities, is monitored at the nationaland subnational levels, through disaggregated, high-quality and timely data and analysis that informs national and sub-nationalpolicies, strategies and budgets that benefit children

description.narrative: UNICEF applied a results-based management approach, defining clear results chains with clear baselines and targets for 2021, and implemented a plan for monitoring and evaluation (EISI). Annual Work Plan effectiveness and progress towards outcome and output indicators was measured based on the mid-year and annual reviews undertaken by Results Groups for each programme pillar. High-quality and disaggregated data were collected on a timely basis, and data analysis was done though digital and innovative platforms to inform national and sub-national policies, strategies and budgets that benefit children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
